intro: Talinum coahuilense, commonly known as Coahuila morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the Bindweed family (Convolvulaceae) and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and twining. Talinum coahuilense is adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
